PAD_Summon.synopsis: Boo summon. [POTENTIALLY REDUNDANT - I'VE WRITTEN ANOTHER FILES WITH MORE VARIANTS THAN THIS]

PAD_BooDied.synopsis: Boo died and a long rest has to happen before summoning him again.

PAD_ToInventory.synopsis: Player tries to move Boo from Minc's inventory. Feedback for when returning him with Minsc.

PAD_Retreat.synopsis: Minsc shouts to unsummon Boo (after using the inventory item or Boo dies).

AD_ThrowBoo.synopsis: Player throws Boo at an enemy and yells out
AD_ThrowBoo.how_to_trigger: Recruit MinscSummon Boo familiarThrow Boo at an enemy

PAD_Summon_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_Summon_0.text: Go for the eyes, Boo! Go for the eyes!

PAD_BooDied_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_BooDied_0.text: SHHH! Can you not see that Boo is resting? Poke again tomorrow, you monster.
PAD_BooDied_0.context: NodeContext: Loud Minsc whisper - should be directed, tongue in cheek, at player - we've just tried to use Boo but a long rest is required first.

PAD_ToInventory_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_ToInventory_0.text: HEY! Do not roust Boo when he is COMFORTABLE!

PAD_Retreat_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_Retreat_0.text: You have done enough, Boo! Come and rest in my pouch.
PAD_Retreat_0.context: NodeContext: Said when Boo is unsummoned. We never see where Boo goes, so the implication of 'pouch' should deepen the reader's existential crisis with every repetition.

AD_ThrowBoo_0.speaker: Player
AD_ThrowBoo_0.context: NodeContext: Gale: 'Pete Oculos' is latin for 'go for the eyes'. /ˈpe.te/, [ˈpɛt̪ɛ]. oculōs has a short o at the start and a long one at the end.

AD_ThrowBoo_1.speaker: Player
AD_ThrowBoo_1.context: NodeContext: Repeated barks every time Minsc throws Boo at an enemy.
